meta.description: Stress Test Corpus for Abstract Wikipedia: Winograd Schemas and Idioms

winograd_schemas.source_text: The trophy would not fit in the brown suitcase because it was too big.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: The pronoun 'it' refers to the 'trophy'. If the sentence ended 'because it was too small', 'it' would refer to the suitcase.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: In French, does the pronoun match the gender of 'trophy' (le trophée - M) or 'suitcase' (la valise - F)?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The town councilors refused to give the demonstrators a permit because they feared violence.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'They' refers to the 'councilors'. If the word was 'advocated' instead of 'feared', 'they' would refer to the 'demonstrators'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation imply the councilors were the ones afraid, or the demonstrators?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The large ball crashed right through the table because it was made of styrofoam.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'table' (styrofoam is weak). If the sentence read 'made of steel', 'it' would refer to the ball.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: In Portuguese, does 'it' match the gender of 'table' (mesa - F) or 'ball' (bola - F)?

winograd_schemas.source_text: John could not see the stage with Billy in front of him because he is so short.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'He' refers to John. If the sentence ended 'because he is so tall', 'he' would refer to Billy.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation explicitly link the attribute of 'shortness' to John?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The delivery truck zoomed by the school bus because it was going so fast.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'truck'. If it ended 'going so slow', 'it' would refer to the 'bus'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Identify the subject of the verb 'going'. Is it the truck or the bus?

winograd_schemas.source_text: Frank felt crushed when his longtime rival Bill won the award because he had worked so hard for it.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'He' refers to Frank (the loser who worked hard). Context implies the emotional crush comes from the effort.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation attribute the hard work to Frank?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The man couldn't lift his son because he was so weak.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'He' refers to the 'man'. If it ended 'because he was so heavy', 'he' would refer to the 'son'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the adjective 'weak' modify the father or the son?

winograd_schemas.source_text: I poured water from the bottle into the cup until it was full.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'cup'. If it read 'until it was empty', 'it' would refer to the 'bottle'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: In Spanish, does the adjective 'full' (lleno/llena) agree with 'cup' (taza - F) or 'bottle' (botella - F)?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The lawyer asked the witness a question, but he was reluctant to answer it.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'He' refers to the 'witness'. Lawyers ask; witnesses answer.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation identify the 'witness' as the reluctant party?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The painting looked out of place in the room because it was too modern.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'painting'. If it read 'too old-fashioned', it could refer to the room contextually, but here 'it' is the painting.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: In French, does 'it' agree with 'painting' (peinture - F) or 'room' (pièce - F)?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The firemen arrived after the police because they were coming from far away.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'They' refers to the 'firemen' (the late arrivers).
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation attribute the distance to the firemen?

winograd_schemas.source_text: Paul tried to call George on the phone, but he wasn't successful.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'He' refers to Paul (the one trying).
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation imply Paul failed, or that George wasn't successful at something else?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The dog chased the cat up the tree because it was terrified.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'cat'. If it read 'because it was aggressive', 'it' would refer to the 'dog'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the adjective 'terrified' apply to the cat?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The sack of potatoes was heavier than the bag of flour, so I carried it first.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'sack of potatoes'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: In a language where sack and bag have different genders, which one is the object pronoun?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The sculpture rolled off the shelf because it wasn't anchored.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'sculpture'. If it read 'because it was tilted', 'it' would refer to the 'shelf'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation apply 'not anchored' to the sculpture?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The older students bullied the younger ones because they were cruel.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'They' refers to the 'older students'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation attribute cruelty to the older students?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The customer complained to the waiter because he had brought the wrong soup.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'He' refers to the 'waiter'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation clearly identify who brought the soup?

winograd_schemas.source_text: Sam pulled on the door handle but it wouldn't budge.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'door' (or the handle, contextually tied).
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: In German, door is Tür (F) and handle is griff (M). Which gender is used?

winograd_schemas.source_text: I put the heavy cake in the refrigerator because it was melting.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'cake'. Refrigerators don't melt.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation say the cake is melting?

winograd_schemas.source_text: The bee landed on the flower because it had pollen.
winograd_schemas.trap_explanation: 'It' refers to the 'flower'.
winograd_schemas.target_failure_check: Does the translation attribute the possession of pollen to the flower?

idioms.source_text: The project manager decided to bite the bullet and fire the consultant.
idioms.trap_explanation: 'Bite the bullet' means to endure a painful experience, not to bite ammunition.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention teeth or metal? If so, it failed.

idioms.source_text: After the argument, she gave him the cold shoulder.
idioms.trap_explanation: 'Cold shoulder' means to ignore someone, not a temperature-related body part.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention temperature (cold) or anatomy (shoulder) literally?

idioms.source_text: It is raining cats and dogs outside.
idioms.trap_explanation: Means it is raining very heavily. No animals involved.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention animals?

idioms.source_text: Don't spill the beans about the surprise party.
idioms.trap_explanation: 'Spill the beans' means to reveal a secret.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation involve legumes or dropping food?

idioms.source_text: He kicked the bucket last night.
idioms.trap_explanation: Euphemism for dying.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation involve a pail or a foot action?

idioms.source_text: That physics exam was a piece of cake.
idioms.trap_explanation: Means it was very easy.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention dessert or food?

idioms.source_text: We need to address the elephant in the room.
idioms.trap_explanation: An obvious problem that people are avoiding discussing.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention a large mammal?

idioms.source_text: Stop beating around the bush and tell me the truth.
idioms.trap_explanation: Means to delay or avoid getting to the point.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention plants or hitting something?

idioms.source_text: He is the black sheep of the family.
idioms.trap_explanation: A disreputable or odd member of a group.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention the color black or farm animals?

idioms.source_text: I'm feeling under the weather today.
idioms.trap_explanation: Feeling sick or unwell.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation talk about meteorology or being beneath something?

idioms.source_text: You are barking up the wrong tree.
idioms.trap_explanation: Accusing the wrong person or pursuing a mistaken line of thought.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention dogs or trees?

idioms.source_text: It costs an arm and a leg.
idioms.trap_explanation: It is very expensive.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention body parts or surgery?

idioms.source_text: Let's call it a day.
idioms.trap_explanation: Stop working for the present time.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation literally mean 'name it a day'?

idioms.source_text: He let the cat out of the bag.
idioms.trap_explanation: He revealed a secret.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention a feline or a sack?

idioms.source_text: Don't put all your eggs in one basket.
idioms.trap_explanation: Don't risk everything on a single venture.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention farming, eggs, or baskets?

idioms.source_text: She missed the boat on the crypto investment.
idioms.trap_explanation: She was too late to take an opportunity.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention water transport?

idioms.source_text: That happens once in a blue moon.
idioms.trap_explanation: Very rarely.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention the color or the moon?

idioms.source_text: He jumped on the bandwagon when the team started winning.
idioms.trap_explanation: Joined a popular trend or activity.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention a wagon or jumping?

idioms.source_text: I'm going to hit the sack.
idioms.trap_explanation: Go to sleep.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation involve physical violence against a bag?

idioms.source_text: The ball is in your court now.
idioms.trap_explanation: It is your turn to take action.
idioms.target_failure_check: Does the translation mention sports or tennis?
